title: Opening

author: Chris Welty, IBM Thomas J. Watson Research Center

segmentation: Good eye.
Welcome to Sydney.
We acknowledge and celebrate the first Australians on whose traditional lands we meet and pay our respects to the elders of the Gadigal people past and present.

All the previous conferences had lower numbers.
Last year was pretty close.
It was was the 11th.
But as you're going to see, 12 is much higher and much better.
So it's it's really a big change.
The third change I'd like to call your attention to is in the program, so we have several changes to the overall program this year that are different from previous years.
For those of you who are accustomed to the way we have done things in the past.
We shortened the length of all the technical presentations to 20 minutes.

And lengthened the brakes, and for those of us on the organizing team who really enjoy the brakes as opportunities to more directly engage with each other, and to ask deeper questions about the interesting presentations and short presentations really forces a presenter to focus on the few points that they really want to get across.
You don't end up getting stuck for 1/2 an hour in a presentation that maybe you're not as interested in as you thought you were.
So I would like some feedback that we would all like some feedback, especially next years.
Organizers, which we'll discuss later.

And this I should mention our exclusive isw.

The the web page is linked to from the conference.
The main conference page, so you should go there or the first time you hit it, it will be downloading all the data, so it may seem a little slow, but after that it will be much faster.
It gives you the capability of scrolling through the program as you might with pen and paper and marking the marking the sessions that you want to see.

The information that you provide the the papers that you want to see comes up on a separate screen so you can see a customized view of the program with the papers that you've marked as as wanting to see and that information is also stored and we can use it for future analytics about the program so.
Try to participate if you're interested in sharing that kind of information.
Another thing we changed this year is that the three tracks.
There's a research track and in use track and the evaluation and experiments track previous years.

Those papers were presented in their own sessions, but we've merged all of the three track presentations by subject, so papers from the different tracks on on the same subject are presented in the same sessions.
I also want to point out that there's a minute minute Madness session at the end of the day today, as preliminary to the posters and demo session.
Minute man.
This is something that some other conferences do, but we do as well.
It's sort of an advertising session for the posters and demos, but is very exciting because each presenter has only one minute to give their presentation.
The slides are advanced automatically so they simply can't take any longer and it ends up being very exciting and most of the presenters.
Pretty good job of trying to attract your attention in the one minute of fame that they have there.
